lg.l: Careful observers may fortel the hour,
By sure prognosticks when to dread a shower:
While rain depends, the pensive cat gives o'er,
Her frolicks, & pursues her tail no more.
Returning home at night you'll find the sink,
Strikes your offended nose with double stinkcropped
If you be wise then go not far to dine,
You'll spend in Coach-hire more than saves in wincropped
A coming show'r your shooting corns presage,
Old akes throb, your hollow tooth will rage.
Mean while the South rising with dabbling wings
A sable cloud a路thwart the welking flings.
That swallowd more liquor than it coud contain
And like a drunkard gives it up again.
Brisk Susan whips her linnen from the rope,
While the first drizling show'r is born aslope.
Such is that sprinkling which some careless quean
Flirts on you from her mop, but not so clean.
You fly, invoke the gods, then turning stop,
To rail; she singing, still whirls on her mop.
Now in contiguous drops the flood comes down,
Threat路ning with deluge this devoted Town.
To shops in crouds, the dragled females fly,
Pretend to cheapen goods, but nothing buy,
The templer spruce while ev'ry spouts a路broach,
Stays 'till 'tis fair, yet seem路s to call a coach.
The tuckd up sempstress walks with hasty stridescropped
While streams run down her oild umbrellas sides,
Here various kinds by various fortunes led,
Commence acquaintance underneath a shed.
Triumphant tories, & desponding whigs,
Forget their fewids, & join to save their wigs.
Boxd in a chair the beau impatient sits,
While spouts run clatt'ring o'er the roof by fits.
And ever & anon with frightful din.
The leather sounds, he trembles from within.136-083Y
